intro: Armeria colorata, commonly known as the sea thrift, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Europe and North Africa. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, evergreen foliage and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in maritime climates. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Armeria colorata is also valued for its ability to tolerate salt spray and harsh weather conditions.
